intro: Aletris spicata var. microantha, commonly known as the small-flowered wood sorrel, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
